QueryText: Asking about Dasagavya preparation and dosage limt
KccAns: Recommended for Neem , Erukam, Kolingi, Notchi,umathai , Katamanaku, Adathoda and Pungam.The plant extracts are prepared by separately soaking the foliage in cow urine in 1:1 ratio (1 kg chopped leaves in 1 litre cow urine) for ten days. The filtered extracts of all the plants are then added @ 1 litre each to 5 litre of the panchagavya solution. The mixture is kept for 25 days and stirred well, meanwhile, To ensure thorough mixing of panchagavya and the plant extracts.The Dasagavya solution is filtered to avoid clogging of sprayer nozzles and is recommended as foliar spray at 3 % (30 ml / per lit of water)concentration. Soaking of seeds or dipping the roots of seedlings in 3 % (30 ml / per lit of water) solution of dasagavya for 20 minutes before planting enhances seed germination and root development.

QueryText: Asking about paddy ADT 50 paddy variety details

QueryText: Asking about Banana planting method
KccAns: Recommended for Select sword suckers of 1.5 to 2.0 kg weight which are free from diseases and nematodes. Trim the roots and decayed portion of the corm, cut the pseudostem leaving 20 cm from the corm and grade the suckers to size. To avoid wilt disease in Rasthali, Monthan, Virupakshi and other wilt susceptible varieties. Pralinage is done with 40 g of Carbofuran 3 G granules per sucker. (Dip the corm in slurry solution containing 4 parts clay plus 5 parts water and sprinkle Carbofuran to control nematodes).

QueryText: Asking about Paddy fall smut management
KccAns: Recommended for Among the cultural control, destruction of straw and stubble from infected plants is recommended to reduce the disease.Avoid field activities when the plants are wet. Field bunds and irrigation channels should be kept clean to eliminate alternate hosts.Use of disease-free seeds that are selected from healthy crop.Split application of nitrogen is recommended.Seed treatment with carbendazim 2.0g/kg of seeds. spray Pseudomonas fluorescens 10g per liter of water at 3 times at 10 days interval .

QueryText: asking about Symptoms of blast in paddy
KccAns:
recommended for Initial symptoms are white to gray-green lesions or spots with brown borders
Small specks originate on leaves - subsequently enlarge into spindle shaped spots with ashy center. 
Older lesions are elliptical or spindle-shaped and whitish to gray with necrotic borders. Several spots coalesce to form big irregular patches.
